== HELP ==

Original code by Dennis Mantz 2021 Modified by Martin at msf455@gmail.com.
  • Updated libraries and targeted latest Android build
  • Changed text buttons to symbols
  • Fit buttons to the screen in portrait
  • Cleaned up launcher icon
  • Added preselect on frequency
    • Use this to record the signal coming off a radio, key fob or remote control. Adjust the sample rate which is defaulted to the 20M max Connect a HackRF to your device via an OTG USB cable. You may need to install an Android RTL-SDR driver app. Press app USB symbol, give the App the permissions to open the USB device and hit Info to read out the Board ID, Version, Part ID and Serial Number from your device. ⇩ will start receiving samples at the given sample rate and store them to a file on your SD card. Do not leave the filename blank. The default is hackrf_android.iq. With ⇧ you can transmit a previously recorded file.

    □ will stop either recording/receiving and transmitting of the saved file. The hackrf_android.iq file is in the HackRF app default documents data directory, for example Android/data/com.s33me.myhackrf/files/Documents/Test_HackRF/. To transmit the recorded signal file, maximize the VGA gain and minimize LNA.

    For more information on how to use hackrf_android in your own application see
    http://tech.mantz-it.com/2014/10/hackrfandroid-using-hackrf-with-android.html

    Get the latest version (binaries and sources) from the Github repository:
    https://github.com/demantz/hackrf_android
